name: Cody Cowboy Village

reviews.text: Very cozy charming duplex cabins arranged around the reception building and spa. Easy drive up access to room.
reviews.title: Perfect little cabins on the edge of town

reviews.text: Very well maintained. Built in 2006, they show little sign of wear.
reviews.title: Best beds and pillows!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room very tastefully furnished offering a very comfortable king bed. Bathroom and shower to a good standard. Petra, the manager was great.
reviews.title: had a great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Adequate continental breakfast included.
reviews.title: Over priced..Expensive, NO INTERNET IN YOUR ROOM..

reviews.text: A little more money than we were aiming to spend, but so much more worth it than a bland charmless chain hotel. Cody was quite pricey anyway at this time of year anyway.
reviews.title: Very Nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed twice at the Cody Cowboy Village during our trip (first and last night) as it is conveniently located for a late arrival or an early departure from Cody airport. Checking in, after our 14 hour journey, was quick, easy and friendly. Our room (No. 125) was very spacious, nicely decorated, quiet and the bed was extremely comfortable. Parking was convenient, right outside each cabin. The only negative comment I have is that during our second stay, the cabin (No. 150) assigned to us was located very close to the main road and we found the traffic noise to be somewhat bothersome. Above that - we definitely recommend it!
reviews.title: Great Value in Cody

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really loved this hotel, and wouldn't hesitate to return. We stayed for seven nights, and used this as our base camp for Yellowstone, Top of the World and Beartooth Pass, as well as enjoying the Buffalo Bill Cody Stampede in all of its splendor. The king size bed was so comfortable that we took the sheets off to check out the type of mattress. Petra, the Manager, was so accommodating and helpful with every request. Each cabin comes with the basics - bed, TV, lamps, phone, shower, tile bathroom, and then a porch with two chairs. We weren't in Cody to stay in our rooms, but in all honesty, we slept better in this bed than our own. Definitely one of the cleanest hotels we've stayed in.
reviews.title: Basic, Clean and Comfortable in Cowboy Country

reviews.text: My wife and I and our extended family (16 in all) spent a number of nights at the Cody Cowboy Village. The rooms were very clean and comfortable, and the location was just a short walk from the Cody rodeo grounds where we enjoyed the Cody night rodeo and the Fourth of July Cody Stampede. There is a pool which our children and grandchildren liked. The Cody Cowboy Village serves a nice continental breakfast, and the staff is very helpful and friendly. In particular, we worked with Petra who worked hard to arrange to have our rooms together and was invaluable in assisting us in the logistics of four families arriving in Cody at different times over a three day period. She could not have been more helpful. This is a good bet for your base of operations for a visit to Cody and Yellowstone National Park.
reviews.title: An excellent motel!

reviews.text: Cowboy Village hypes their property as if it is luxury but in reality it is lower than an average motel. The room was tiny, no closet, too small for a small twin rollaway unless we moved all the furniture around, and the free continental breakfast was poor. AT $145. per night for a tiny cabin room with skimpy towels and not even decent cereal choices, this was a big disappointment.
reviews.title: Big Hype - over rated, over claimed

reviews.text: Somewhat obscured by U-Haul trucks next door, the Cody Cowboy Village was a delightful surprise. Spacious, comfortable rooms, nicely decorated, modern. In room WIFI. Clean.
reviews.title: Surprisingly nice

reviews.text: After extensive research on tripadvisor :), the family decided on staying at CCV for 5 days during our vacation trip to Yellowstone area. We booked one of their suites and were so pleased with our choice! The rooms are spotless, plasma sets in bed and living room, great showers... not to mention the beds! They truly are the most comfortable beds I've slept in on any vacation ever!
reviews.title: Best in the West!

likes.disliked: — not enough shrubs, grass, etc., too much asphalt.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff at CCV are the most genuinely helpful, most friendly I've encountered. They directed us to some of the best restaurants, sight seeing and suggestions within the area and then some.
reviews.title: Exactly as described

likes.liked: — Large modern clean comfortable room with no hassles.

reviews.text: Definitely check out the rodeo ( no matter how corny it sounds), the Cody museum, Irma's, and the Wyoming Rib & Chop House (make reservations anywhere) for the best Bison steak I ever tasted! And take a river raft trip!!
reviews.title: Can't say enough good things...

likes.liked: — Comfort of the rooms, beds, pillows, etc. Friendliness of the staff
likes.disliked: — Only complaint would be the shower- weird configuration- couldn't adjust the shower head.

reviews.text: Yellowstone is the best, make sure you enter by both east and north routes to get the best of everything. The only small let down on a perfect vacation was the Monmouth hot springs... not worth the extensive hike. But what a beautiful park... Old Faithful and Upper/Lower falls are a must!
reviews.title: Feels like you're in a Western

reviews.text: Rooms look new, although property is 3 years old. The rooms were large, comfortable, and good looking. This is a great value for the Yellowstone area. The breakfast was nothing to write home about, but overall if you are looking for value e.g. a great room at an affordable price, this is it in Cody.
reviews.title: Best hotel of the west!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very clean and roomy. The staff were friendly and helpful. Overall great experience. We would stay there again.
reviews.title: Great place to stay!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well my wife and I have differing opinions of this place. The things that I didn't like were parking is limited, so you have to squeeze into inconvienient spots. They don't have an ice machine. The rooms are small and dark. My wife thought the room had character. She liked the cowboy decor, thought the dark room was cozy. Staff was nice and helpful. Breakfast was limited. To me there was nothing really wrong with the place, but nothing to rave about.
reviews.title: Mixed Opinion

reviews.text: For a total of $156/night (incl. taxes), this is completely not worth the money. The motels are all overpriced since you are paying for being close to Yellowstone but It is definitely not "value for your money." I rented a king room. No frig, no coffee maker, no internet access (except the lobby) and no table to sit at while in the room. They are set up like duplexes--I could hear the person's TV in the room adjoining mine. The breakfast is a choice of 2 cereals & a banana with milk + some doughnuts + lots of sytrofoam to put it in! How hard is it to wash a bowl or at least use degradable paper plates! The place also smells but I think it is some pervasive sulfur smell throughout Cody since I could also detect it at the airport. The bed was comfortable enough as were the pillows but again, not really special. The cutesy cowboy decor did nothing for me. The folks at the front desk were friendly. Last, it is also at the far end of town--there is nothing around there except (ugh) Walmart.
reviews.title: Not worth the money

reviews.text: We were traveling with friends from the UK and stayed here for two nights in June. This motel was the highlight of our trip. We found ours rooms to be spotlessly clean , well maintained and totally comfortable. Great beds and lots of pillows! We loved the small sitting area outside the cabin and enjoyed a glass of wine with our friends there each evening. We found the staff members to be friendly and very accommodating. When we called to change our reservations in the middle of our trip, Petra not only found us rooms but rearranged others so that we could be side-by-side with our friends something that we had not even requested but truly appreciated the time she spent doing this. A great place to stay!
reviews.title: Great Place!

reviews.text: Quaint, in walking distance of the Rodeo. Great suites. Clerk at check-in said there was oatmeal on the breakfast and morning clerk said they never serve it in warm weather, even though "several people have asked about it this morning." Hmmm.
reviews.title: Found it on Trip Advisor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Poor breakfast The rest well A beautiful site to remain though this one far from the center
reviews.title: Nice Place

reviews.text: Great location, beautiful & clean rooms, helpful staff, nice breakfast. Beds are super comfy. Our first choice for accomodations in Cody! The cabin style hotel is located on west side of town near rodeo grounds and a perfect location to enjoy July 4th fireworks!!!!! Thanks Cowboy Village for a wonderful stay!
reviews.title: First class accomodations in cowboy style!

reviews.text: We spent only one night in Cody. It was refreshing to have queen size beds after sharing double beds the night before. We fit 3 people in a room. There wasn't alot of floor space for suitcases but the hotel was new. Our room had a flat screen TV that we used to check the weather report and news. The shower was powerful. There was a small patio out front with two chairs-we just had no time to enjoy it. The weather was hot in Cody so the pool would have been refeshing but it was crowded with kids and closes at 10 pm. The location was right next to the Old Trail Town attraction and the nightly Rodeo. We walked to the rodeo.
reviews.title: New hotel, close to the rodeo, good choice

reviews.text: We stayed one night here on our tour of Yellowston and the Grand Tetons. Checkin took a few minutes but Petra was great. She was a fountain of good information and made some great recommendations. The room was tight for space, the two queen beds took up most of the space. The bathroom has a shower only which was fine. The ice is only available at check in desk, which closes at 10pm. The pool was small and always overflowing with kids, we never did get to try it. The hotel is within walking distance of the rodeo, along a sidewalk through the field it was very nice. On our way back we had to wait for a deer to cross in front of us. The hotel is also right next to the Old trail town which was really nice. We skipped the breakfast and went across the street for a hot breakfast. Overall this was a nice place to stay. Would I stay again, probably...I don't like my ice to be rationed.
reviews.title: Nice cabins, great location for the rodeo and old trail town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am very particular about where I stay. The rooms were exceptional. Clean, bright, vaulted ceilings, the bed the sheets! amazing. Very close to town but far enough away to get away from it all. It takes about 5 minutes to reach town by car. You can walk to the old time town museum and also you can walk to the rodeo and avoid the traffic. Excellent trading post directly across the street. I wish the breakfast had more healthier bread options, but there was cereal, bananas, coffee, and juice also. I really can not say enough about this location and cabins. A+ Petra is very helpful! have her book the trail ride through the Shoshone National Forest- it was life changing, climbed mountains with horses! also go to the chuck wagon dinner right next door (again leave your car at your cabin) you will be pleasantly surprised!
reviews.title: excellent family place or romantic place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cody Cowboy Village is on the highway next to Old Trail Town--which is definitely worth visiting--but outside the town of Cody. The motel bills itself as "luxury log cabin lodging" but don't expect individual log cabins, as the rooms are grouped in buildings. But they are indeed made of logs and nicely furnished, with very comfy beds, duvets, great pillows and flat-screen cable TV. But there were two major flaws: inadequate illumination (lampshades that allowed little light to pass through and a very nice reading chair but no lamp nearby); and the worst showerhead in the West. It's placed too high and isn't adjustable, so you have no alternative but to stand in the small shower stall and get sprayed in the face. I chatted with a man staying in the next cabin, who said he bought and installed a flexible-hose showerhead on his second day there!
reviews.title: A lot that's right, a lot that needs improvement

reviews.text: I mentioned these problems to the manager, who said they were planning to improve on both counts. If this should occur, Cody Cowboy Village would be a lovely place to stay.
reviews.title: The best bed in a 4000 mile trip

reviews.text: Continental breakfast consisted of two cereals, bananas and pastries; I would have welcomed a few more healthy alternatives. High marks for cleanliness and nice management.
reviews.title: OUTSTANDING! What can I add that hasn't been said before here...

likes.liked: — Beds, layout of rooms, staff helpfulness, location, flat screen tvs in every room
likes.disliked: — Insufficient lighting in rooms, barren grounds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The most comfortable bed, by far, than all the places we stayed, grand and not-so-grand, on a cross country road trip from Alaska to Pennsylvania and back - 4,000 plus miles! Though the location was just a pit stop off the highway leading into Cody, without a view to speak of, but the cabin/rooms were lovely and the staff friendly and helpful. After a long day on the road, our room was a pleasant oasis, a nice bathroom with thick, fluffy towels, a large flat screen TV, large COMFORTABLE bed, with fluffy warm comforter. Absolutely loved the place.
reviews.title: Cody Cowboy Village, The Best Facility in Town

likes.disliked: — Nothing. It was the best hotel/motel we've had in 3 cross country trips in 3 years.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Could this be the best rest in the West? Quite likely.
reviews.title: Cowboy Nirvana

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a great place! I stayed here with a friend who was a repeat guest and I loved it! The log cabin/rooms are VERY clean and nice and roomy. The bathroom was also very clean with real, thick, soft towels. They advertise as having the best beds in the West and they just might. The beds are very comfortable with nice big fluffy pillows and soft sheets. The owners are very friendly and offer a continental breakfast and attraction suggestions for guest but there is a nice little breakfast joint just across the street. this property sits just on the edge of town so it is very close to everything in Cody. I think the price is reasonable for what they offer and while i am sure you can find cheaper rooms I doubt you will find any place cleaner than this property inside and out. I want a clean, comfortable room and this place is both. Thanks for a great stay.
reviews.title: I love CCV!!!

likes.liked: — Clean and comfortable, great western atmosphere

reviews.text: We spent two nights, August 16th & August 17th, at Cody Cowboy Village. After reading all the positive reviews on Trip Advisor, we decided this was the place to stay while we were in Cody.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our two night stay in Cody Cowboy Village!

reviews.text: We had a "suite" which was a small cabin to ourselves. There were two Queen beds in the bedroom and a Queen pull out sofa sleeper in the living room area. The decor was very nice with fun cowboy and western touches. There was one small flat screen TV in the living room area and one small flat screen TV in the bedroom area. We had a small fridge in the living room area and a small table along with a sofa and comfy chair. There was a small porch out front with some comfortable chairs. The beds were comfortable......not sure if they were "the BEST" in the West but they were nice.
reviews.title: excellent

reviews.text: The staff was helpful but I felt like they pushed a lot of the local interest things. I guess they all try to support each other. We weren't really interested in spending a lot of money to see the many tourist attractions in Cody. We traveled through this area to see the natural attractions and Yellowstone National Park.
reviews.title: A wonderful place

reviews.text: You are right next door to the rodeo and very close to the Buffalo Bill Historical Center. The town of Cody has some cute tourist shops and local restaurants.
reviews.title: EXCELLENT

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All the previous comments just echo my opinions! This has to be one of the best places I have stayed and yes the beds are as good as everyone says!
reviews.title: Perfect!

reviews.text: we stay unfortunately only two nights at the cow boy village, cody.
reviews.title: lovely stay at cowboy village cody wy

likes.liked: — kindness of owner and cleaning of rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the cabins are very nice and carefully cleaned. the village is very luxury and familiar ambient. breakfast was great, the owner too, very nice with us. the bathroom is lovely, the room furniture too.we definitely suggest this hotel to everybody, families or couples.
reviews.title: Fantastic! Stay Here!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: you might see rabbits outside the cabin. we did! hope to come back.
reviews.title: OMG The Beds are the best on the planet!

likes.liked: — The beds were the most comfortable beds we have ever slept in!
likes.disliked: — The pool was a little small.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: thanks for excellent service.
reviews.title: The best place to stay in Cody!

likes.liked: — Comfort and value of the rooms

description: Hotel located at the east entrance to Yellowstone park. Facility has the "best Beds in the West." These beds are triple sheeted with very high thread count linens.
